bug.author: ToonTalk
bug.description:
To get help from the community, we encourage using Stack Overflow and the <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/tensorflow.js>tensorflow.js</denchmark-link> tag. <denchmark-h:h4>TensorFlow.js version</denchmark-h>
1.04 <denchmark-h:h4>Browser version</denchmark-h>
Chrome Version 73.0.3683.103 (Official Build) (64-bit) <denchmark-h:h4>Describe the problem or feature request</denchmark-h>
When I used classifier.clearClass and then recreated that class in a loop tf.memory showed a tensor memory leak. When instead I disposed of the entire classifier and recreated all the classes there was no memory leak. <denchmark-h:h4>Code to reproduce the bug / link to feature request</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/onyx/memory-leak-index.html>https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/onyx/memory-leak-index.html</denchmark-link>
after a few minutes after loading - console shows the tf.memory on each iteration
